universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Class CalendarView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView
          • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.CalendarView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable.Callback, AccessibilityEventSource, KeyEvent.Callback, ViewManager, ViewParent, Widget

    public class CalendarView
extends RecyclerView
implements Widget
    A RecyclerView implementation designed to present data set of months. Calendar view uses by default MonthView widget as item view for its default adapter. The date (months) range that should be presented by the calendar view can be specified through its adapter via CalendarView.CalendarAdapter.setMinMaxDate(long, long), where if you want to be presented "infinite" amount of months, specify 0 as maxDateInMillis attribute. The calendar adapter can be accessed via getCalendarAdapter(). If needed custom implementation of CalendarView.CalendarAdapter can be specified via #setCalendarAdapter(Adapter) in such case CalendarView.CalendarDataSet helper class can be used to simplify months data set management.

    Initial selected date can be specified via setSelectedDate(java.util.Date) or setSelectedDate(long) and the current selected date can be obtained via getSelectedDate() or getSelectedDateInMillis().

    Callbacks

    Use CalendarView.OnDateSelectionListener to listen for callback about selected date. This listener can be registered via setOnDateSelectionListener(OnDateSelectionListener) and its callback will be fired whenever a user selects its desired date (a specific number within the currently visible month view).

    If you want to listen for changes in month or year that are caused by scrolling of the calendar view, use CalendarView.OnMonthChangeListener and CalendarView.OnYearChangeListener. These listeners can be registered via setOnMonthChangeListener(OnMonthChangeListener) and setOnYearChangeListener(OnYearChangeListener).

    XML attributes

    CalendarView Attributes

    Default style attribute

    uiCalendarViewStyle
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  CalendarView.CalendarAdapter
      Interface for adapter that provides data set of months for CalendarView.
      static class  CalendarView.CalendarDataSet
      Helper class that may be used to simplify management of months data set provided by implementation of CalendarView.CalendarAdapter.
      static interface  CalendarView.OnDateSelectionListener
      Listener that can receive callback about selected date within CalendarView.
      static interface  CalendarView.OnMonthChangeListener
      Listener that can receive callback about changed month by scroll within CalendarView.
      static interface  CalendarView.OnMonthDaySelectionListener
      Extension of MonthView.OnDaySelectionListener used by CalendarView to listen for selected day for a specific month within the calendar view's adapter's data set.
      static interface  CalendarView.OnYearChangeListener
      Listener that can receive callback about changed year by scroll within CalendarView.
      static class  CalendarView.SavedState
      A WidgetSavedState implementation used to ensure that the state of CalendarView is properly saved.
      static class  CalendarView.SimpleCalendarAdapter
      A CalendarView.CalendarAdapter implementation that provides simple data set of months for CalendarView.

      Same as getVisibleDateInMillis() for Date object.

      boolean smoothScrollToNextMonth()
      Scrolls smoothly to the next month if this calendar view is not already scrolled at its last month available.
      boolean smoothScrollToPreviousMonth()
      Scrolls smoothly to the previous month if this calendar view is not already scrolled at its first month available.

      • setOrientation

        public void setOrientation(int orientation)
        Sets an orientation in which should be month views layout within this calendar view. This is the same as calling RecyclerView.setLayoutManager(LayoutManager) with instance of LinearLayoutManager and the specified orientation.
        Parameters:
        orientation - The desired orientation. Should be one of RecyclerView.HORIZONTAL or RecyclerView.VERTICAL.
        See Also:
        android:orientation, LinearLayoutManager.LinearLayoutManager(Context, int, boolean), getOrientation()

      • getOrientation

        public int getOrientation()
        Returns the current orientation of this calendar view.
        Returns:
        Current orientation as specified for the layout manager (if instance of LinearLayoutManager) or -1 if this calendar view does not have layout manger type of LinearLayoutManager specified.
        See Also:
        setOrientation(int)

      • setLayoutManager

        public void setLayoutManager(RecyclerView.LayoutManager layout)
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView
        Set the RecyclerView.LayoutManager that this RecyclerView will use.

        In contrast to other adapter-backed views such as ListView or GridView, RecyclerView allows client code to provide custom layout arrangements for child views. These arrangements are controlled by the RecyclerView.LayoutManager. A LayoutManager must be provided for RecyclerView to function.

        Several default strategies are provided for common uses such as lists and grids.

        Overrides:
        setLayoutManager in class RecyclerView
        Parameters:
        layout - LayoutManager to use

        Parameters:

      • getCalendar

        @NonNull
public final Calendar getCalendar()
        Returns the calendar instance used by this calendar view for date related calculations.

        Note, that changing locale via setLocale(Locale) also changes calendar instance.

        Returns:
        Calendar instance of this calendar view.

      • getCalendarWithSelectedDate

        @NonNull
public final Calendar getCalendarWithSelectedDate()
        Like getCalendar() but here returned calendar will contain time data for the current selected date (if any).
        Returns:
        Calendar instance with selected date (if selected).

      • setLocale

        public void setLocale(@NonNull
                      Locale locale)
        Sets a locale used to display proper names for calendar fields (month name and names of days in week).
        Parameters:
        locale - The desired locale.
        See Also:
        getLocale()

      • getLocale

        @NonNull
public Locale getLocale()
        Returns the current locale used to obtain proper names of calendar fields.

        Note, that this also changes the current adapter's locale via CalendarView.CalendarAdapter.setLocale(Locale).

        Returns:
        This CalendarView's locale or Locale.getDefault() by default.
        See Also:
        setLocale(Locale)

      • setSelectedDate

        public void setSelectedDate(@Nullable
                            Date date)
        Same as setSelectedDate(long) for Date object.
        Parameters:
        date - The desired date to be selected. May be null to clear the current one.
        See Also:
        getSelectedDate()

      • setSelectedDate

        public void setSelectedDate(long dateInMillis)
        Sets a date that should be selected in this calendar view (in one of its month views).

        Note, that setting selected date also changes the current visible date (month) to the selected one. See setVisibleDate(long) for more information.

        Parameters:
        dateInMillis - The desired date to be selected in milliseconds.

      • getSelectedDate

        @Nullable
public Date getSelectedDate()
        Same as getSelectedDateInMillis() for Date object.
        Returns:
        The current selected date.

      • getSelectedDateInMillis

        @Nullable
public Long getSelectedDateInMillis()
        Returns the current selected date that has been selected by a user or via setSelectedDate(long).

        The returned date (if any) will contain data for Calendar.YEAR, Calendar.MONTH, and Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH.

        Returns:
        The current selected date in milliseconds or null if there has not been selected any date yet.

                           Date date)

        Parameters:
        date - The desired visible date.
        See Also:
        getVisibleDate()

      • setVisibleDate

        public void setVisibleDate(long dateInMillis)
        Sets a date on which should be this calendar view at this time scrolled. This basically defines a month in a desired year that should be visible to a user so he/she can pick his/hers desired date.
        Parameters:
        dateInMillis - The desired visible date in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        getVisibleDateInMillis()

      • getVisibleDate

        @NonNull
public Date getVisibleDate()
        Same as getVisibleDateInMillis() for Date object.
        Returns:
        Currently visible date.
        See Also:
        setVisibleDate(Date)

      • getVisibleDateInMillis

        public long getVisibleDateInMillis()
        Returns the date (year + month) on which is this calendar view at this time scrolled.
        Returns:
        Currently visible date in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        setVisibleDate(long)

      • setAdapter

        public final void setAdapter(RecyclerView.Adapter adapter)
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView
        Set a new adapter to provide child views on demand.

        When adapter is changed, all existing views are recycled back to the pool. If the pool has only one adapter, it will be cleared.

        Overrides:
        setAdapter in class RecyclerView
        Parameters:
        adapter - The new adapter to set, or null to set no adapter.
        See Also:
        RecyclerView.swapAdapter(Adapter, boolean)

      • fling

        public boolean fling(int velocityX,
                     int velocityY)
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView
        Begin a standard fling with an initial velocity along each axis in pixels per second. If the velocity given is below the system-defined minimum this method will return false and no fling will occur.
        Overrides:
        fling in class RecyclerView
        Parameters:
        velocityX - Initial horizontal velocity in pixels per second
        velocityY - Initial vertical velocity in pixels per second
        Returns:
        true if the fling was started, false if the velocity was too low to fling or LayoutManager does not support scrolling in the axis fling is issued.
        See Also:
        RecyclerView.LayoutManager.canScrollVertically(), RecyclerView.LayoutManager.canScrollHorizontally()

      • smoothScrollToPreviousMonth

        public boolean smoothScrollToPreviousMonth()
        Scrolls smoothly to the previous month if this calendar view is not already scrolled at its first month available.
        Returns:
        True if the smooth scroll has been performed, false if last month available is already visible.
        See Also:
        canScrollToPreviousMonth(), smoothScrollToNextMonth()

      • canScrollToPreviousMonth

        public boolean canScrollToPreviousMonth()
        Checks whether this calendar view can be scrolled to its previous month or not.
        Returns:
        True if the calendar view is not scrolled at its first month from the current data set and invocation of smoothScrollToPreviousMonth() will return true, false otherwise.

      • smoothScrollToNextMonth

        public boolean smoothScrollToNextMonth()
        Scrolls smoothly to the next month if this calendar view is not already scrolled at its last month available.
        Returns:
        True if the smooth scroll has been performed, false if first month available is already visible.
        See Also:
        canScrollToNextMonth(), smoothScrollToPreviousMonth()

      • canScrollToNextMonth

        public boolean canScrollToNextMonth()
        Checks whether this calendar view can be scrolled to its next month or not.
        Returns:
        True if the calendar view is not scrolled at its last month from the current data set and invocation of smoothScrollToNextMonth() will return true, false otherwise.
